meanings.definition: The state of not being used or employed.
meanings.sent1: After years of disuse, the old bicycle was covered in dust.
meanings.sent2: The disuse of the playground equipment led to its deterioration.
meanings.sent3: The disuse of the forgotten toy made it feel lonely in the corner.
meanings.sent4: Her disuse of social media was like cutting off a connection to the world.
meanings.sent5: The disuse of the neglected garden gave it a wild, overgrown look.

meanings.definition: To cease to use or employ; to abandon.
meanings.sent1: She decided to disuse the old computer and buy a new one.
meanings.sent2: The company had to disuse the outdated machinery to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: He would disuse his old habits and embrace a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent4: The decision to disuse the traditional methods brought about positive changes.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to disuse the spoiled ingredients to ensure the quality of the dish.
